version_description:
Updates in Cardiogram 2.6:
• Sharing Cardiogram charts with your friends and family just got better! When you share on Facebook, Twitter, iMessage, WhatsApp, or most other messaging/social media platforms, the receiving party will now see a preview image directly in the message/post!
• In the Profile tab, you can now add a profile picture! This helps you more easily see your friends when you're working on a Habit together.
• At the end of each week on Sunday mornings, we now show you a new type of Cardiogram: The Week-in-review Cardiogram. This shows you a summary of your workouts this week, as well as comparisons against the previous week.
• On the Watch App, we've fixed continuous recording so that it no longer incorrectly contribute to your exercise minutes.
• We'd love to hear from you if you have any feedback. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.5:
• New UI! The Timeline and Metrics panes are now more beautiful than ever!
• We show you the same heart rate data, except with bigger charts that's easier to read and make gestures like pinch-to-zoom easier to use.
• We now have a brand new set of icons for tagging your heart rate spikes. We hope these will let you become more expressive in how you feel and make sharing your Cardiogram cards with friends more engaging and fun!
• As always, we'd love to hear your feedback as we continue to improve the Cardiogram app. Tell us your thoughts at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0.4:
• Fix Habits invite link for iOS 8 and older.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0.3:
• Invited friends to join you on a Habit, and you can now ping your friends after completing the habit each day to help them stay on track!
• Updated Habits invite link. If your friend doesn't already have Cardiogram installed, the invite link will take him/her to the app store, and once Cardiogram opens, your friend will be added to your Habit automatically.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0.2:
• Fixed one more issue with data refresh, due to a problem with HealthKit permissions when upgrading to iOS 10.1.
• If you're still seeing stale data after upgrading to 2.0.2, try restarting the app (double-click home button, find Cardiogram, and swipe up).
• Please email us if you're still having trouble with data sync: hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0.1:
• Fixed bug where data would not refresh. If you've recently upgraded to iOS 10.1 and you're seeing stale data, please email us: hello@cardiogr.am.
• Updated Cardiogram icon in the app store.
• Smoother transition when selecting a habit from the "All Habits" tab.


Updates in Cardiogram 2.0:

Habits. We all have health goals we're working towards, but it's hard to keep track and keep up each day when you don't have data to measure progress against. We think Cardiogram can help. The Habits tab is designed to help you improve health in 3 categories: Fitness, Sleep, and Stress. Each category offers a set of evidence-based Habits you can try for 14 days. Each day as you complete a Habit, you'll be rewarded with a checkmark to congratulate your daily progress. Plus, you can monitor how the Habit improves your key biometrics, such as resting heart rate and sleep quality, on a daily basis.

To make Habits more fun, invite your friends to join a Habit with you. Research has shown that one of the best ways to keep yourself on track towards a goal is to publicly announce your commitment and work towards it with a group of people with the same goal. You and your friends can keep each other accountable on a daily basis, and motivate each other by comparing your biometric results! So what are you waiting for? Go on, invite a few friends, and find a new habit you'll love!

Also included in Cardiogram 2.0:
• New sleep quality metrics: a) Sleep Duration, and b) Sleeping BPM.
• New and revamped profiles page.

If you have ideas for new Habits to add, we'd love to hear your thoughts! Email us at: hello@cardiogr.am.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.6.1:
• Fixed bug where data would not refresh. With this release, your data will be more up-to-date.
• If you're still seeing stale data after upgrading to 2.6.1, try restarting the app (double-click home button, find Cardiogram, and swipe up).
• Sorry for the inconvenience if you've been seeing syncing issues in the past few weeks.
• As always, if you have any feedback, we'd love to hear from you at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.6:
• Sharing Cardiogram charts with your family and doctors is now a little bit better! When you share via iMessage, WhatsApp, or most other messaging/social media platforms like FB, Twitter, the receiving party will now see a preview image directly in the message/post.
• In the Profile tab, you can now add a profile picture. This helps you more easily see your friends when you're working on a Habit together.
• At the end of each week on Sunday mornings, we now show you a new type of Cardiogram: The Week-in-review Cardiogram. This shows you a summary of your workouts this week, as well as comparisons against the previous week.
• On the Watch App, we've fixed continuous recording so that it no longer incorrectly contribute to your exercise minutes.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.5:
• New UI! The Timeline and Metrics panes are now more beautiful than ever!
• We show you the same heart rate data, except with bigger charts that's easier to read and make gestures like pinch-to-zoom easier to use.
• We now have a brand new set of icons for tagging your heart rate spikes. We hope these will let you become more expressive in how you feel and make sharing your Cardiogram cards with friends more engaging and fun!
• As always, we'd love to hear your feedback as we continue to improve the Cardiogram app. Tell us your thoughts at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0.3:
• Invited friends to join you on a Habit, and you can now ping your friends after completing the habit each day to help them stay on track!
• Updated Habits invite link. If your friend doesn't already have Cardiogram installed, the invite link will take him/her to the app store, and once Cardiogram opens, your friend will be added to your Habit automatically.

• Update graph rendering library.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8:
• To help you stay more active, the new Daily Leaderboard lets you compete your steps with your friends. Challenge each other to be more active and keep each other accountable each day.
• You can even invite friends who don't own an AppleWatch! Daily Leaderboard is compatible with the built-in iPhone step tracker.
• You can also compare your steps against the average in your age group. Your goal each day is to match or surpass the average, or even simply just make progress towards getting closer to it.
• We hope you like it! We're constantly thinking of ways to improve the Cardiogram app, so your feedback is valuable. Email us at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.7:
• We've updated the cardiogram chart so that it loads faster and is easier to read!
• Chart annotations are now easier to edit—simply tap the annotation title, and you'll be zoomed in onto the segment.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.6:
• Sharing Cardiogram charts with your family and doctors is now a little bit easier! When you share via iMessage, WhatsApp, or most other messaging/social media platforms like FB, Twitter, the receiving party will now see a preview image directly in the message/post.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.2:
• Fix syncing issues and empty Timeline tab as seen by a small number of users.
• If you're affected, hope this fixes the issue for you. If you're still seeing issues, email us at hello@cardiogr.am!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.1:
• Bug fix move and exercise activity ring metrics on the Metric tab.
• Bug fix scrolling on Timeline tab.
• Bug fix for data syncing. We've improved syncing from Apple's Health app on app open.

• Cardiogram for iOS 11 is now available.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.1-2.8.3:
• Bug fix move and exercise activity ring metrics on the Metric tab.

• Bug fix for saving Date of Birth.

• We show you the same heart rate data, except with bigger charts that's easier to read and make gestures like pinch-to-zoom easier to use.
• We now have a brand new set of icons for tagging your heart rate spikes. We hope these will let you become more expressive in how you feel and make sharing your Cardiogram cards with friends more engaging and fun!
• As always, we'd love to hear your feedback as we continue to improve the Cardiogram app. Tell us your thoughts at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.0:
Habits. We all have health goals we're working towards, but it's hard to keep track and keep up each day when you don't have data to measure progress against. We think Cardiogram can help. The Habits tab is designed to help you improve health in 3 categories: Fitness, Sleep, and Stress. Each category offers a set of evidence-based Habits you can try for 14 days. Each day as you complete a Habit, you'll be rewarded with a checkmark to congratulate your daily progress. Plus, you can monitor how the Habit improves your key biometrics, such as resting heart rate and sleep quality, on a daily basis.

To make Habits more fun, invite your friends to join a Habit with you. Research has shown that one of the best ways to keep yourself on track towards a goal is to publicly announce your commitment and work towards it with a group of people with the same goal. You and your friends can keep each other accountable on a daily basis, and motivate each other by comparing your biometric results! So what are you waiting for? Go on, invite a few friends, and find a new habit you'll love!

Also included in Cardiogram 2.0:
• New sleep quality metrics: a) Sleep Duration, and b) Sleeping BPM.

If you have ideas for new Habits to add, we'd love to hear your thoughts! Email us at: hello@cardiogr.am.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.6:
• Fixed syncing issue! Sorry for those of you that were not able to log-in or see data in the last few days—the issue is now fixed!
• If you're still seeing issues or have ideas to improve the Cardiogram app, please email us at hello@cardiogr.am. We'd love to hear from you!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.5:
• Cardiogram for iOS 11 is now available.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8.1-2.8.3:
• Bug fix move and exercise activity ring metrics on the Metric tab.
• Bug fix for Health data syncing.
• Bug fix for saving Date of Birth.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.8:
• To help you stay more active, the new Daily Leaderboard lets you compete your steps with your friends. Challenge each other to be more active and keep each other accountable each day.
• You can even invite friends who don't own an AppleWatch! Daily Leaderboard is compatible with the built-in iPhone step tracker.
• You can also compare your steps against the average in your age group. Your goal each day is to match or surpass the average, or even simply just make progress towards getting closer to it.
• We hope you like it!

Updates in Cardiogram 2.7:
• We've updated the cardiogram chart so that it loads faster and is easier to read!
• Chart annotations are now easier to edit—simply tap the annotation title, and you'll be zoomed in onto the segment.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.6:
• Sharing Cardiogram charts with your family and doctors is now a little bit easier! When you share via iMessage, WhatsApp, or most other messaging/social media platforms like FB, Twitter, the receiving party will now see a preview image directly in the message/post.
• In the Profile tab, you can now add a profile picture. This helps you more easily see your friends when you're working on a Habit together.
• At the end of each week on Sunday mornings, we now show you a new type of Cardiogram: The Week-in-review Cardiogram. This shows you a summary of your workouts this week, as well as comparisons against the previous week.

Updates in Cardiogram 2.5:
• New UI! The Timeline and Metrics panes are now more beautiful than ever!
• We show you the same heart rate data, except with bigger charts that's easier to read and make gestures like pinch-to-zoom easier to use.
• We now have a brand new set of icons for tagging your heart rate spikes. We hope these will let you become more expressive in how you feel and make sharing your Cardiogram cards with friends more engaging and fun!
• As always, we'd love to hear your feedback as we continue to improve the Cardiogram app. Tell us your thoughts at hello@cardiogr.am. Thanks!

Cardiogram is now compatible with WearOS watches paired with an iPhone.
We've fixed some crashes and family mode links!

Cardiogram 3.0 is now truly cross-platform. Regardless of whether you wear an Apple Watch, Fitbit, Garmin, or WearOS by Google watch, you can now use Cardiogram's suite of heart rate monitoring tools.
Improved sync behavior and fixed link sharing.
Bug fixes!

-Fixed issues that caused app crashes on iOS 13 and watchOS 5
-Cardiogram Premium prices now show in local currency
Fixed some issues with the new version of Watch OS!

Thanks so much for using Cardiogram!

Apple Watch users, this update contains fixes for watchOS 6 bugs that were causing the heart rate reading on your Cardiogram watch app not to update. This should improve the experience for devices that had a passcode and stopped seeing updated readings after the watch was taken off the wrist and locked for an extended period of time (e.g. overnight charging).

We really appreciate your patience as we spoke to many users to better understand which folks were affected and what was causing the issue. We hope this update enables you to more consistently track your heart rate at a glance!

Thanks so much for using Cardiogram!

Apple Watch users, this update contains fixes for watchOS 6 bugs that were causing the heart rate reading on your Cardiogram watch app not to update. This should improve the experience for devices that had a passcode and stopped seeing updated readings after the watch was taken off the wrist and locked for an extended period of time (e.g. overnight charging). It may take 5-10 seconds for the heart rate reading in your watch app to update.

Bug fixes and new features!

• Restore Purchase: If you previously subscribed to Cardiogram Premium via the App Store but it wasn't unlocked, tap "Restore Purchase" at the bottom of the Premium pane and we'll re-validate your subscription with Apple.

• Heart rate zones: swipe left on workout cardiograms to see a breakdown of your heart rate zones during the workout. Tap a zone for more info.

• Habits: You can now check off habits from previous days. Tap a habit to view the calendar, then tap any day in the past (but after you first enrolled) to mark it as complete—your streaks will update too. We also fixed a bug that prevented some users from navigating between months of the calendar.

•Syncing workouts from Fitbit: to help you get a more detailed look at your heart rate during exercise, you'll automatically see separate workout cardiograms for all workouts tracked in Fitbit.
We now have categories to help you organize your tags!

We've improved sign-in and added more ways to help you journal about your heart rate patterns.

New Features
• Flexible notes on days and workouts to help you remember how you're feeling and communicate your health history to your doctor.
• Quick-tap options to summarize your health or mood.
• 1-min and 2-min heart rate recovery on workouts.
• Star important graphs and retrieve them via search.
• Sign-in with Apple.
• Refer a friend. When they join Cardiogram, both of you will get free Premium for a month.
• Search through your tags by name.

Bug Fixes
• Fixed a few issues that prevented some habits from being marked as complete.
• Show timezone on graphs that have a different timezone than your default. You can also now set your timezone from the Settings pane.
• Fixed an issue causing some users not to be able to retrieve all of their weekly metrics.
• Fixed an issue causing some users not to receive their Share With Doctor reports.

We've added insights and more ways to help you journal about your heart rate patterns.

New Features
• Flexible symptoms on days and workouts to help you remember how you're feeling and communicate your health history to your doctor.
• New insights tailored to you will be available in a carousel at the top of the timeline.

We've added insights and more ways to help you journal about your heart rate patterns.

• Flexible symptoms on days and workouts to help you remember how you're feeling and communicate your health history to your doctor.
• New insights tailored to you will be available in a carousel at the top of the timeline.
Fixes a crash that can happen on startup.

* Added iPad support (beta)
* Fix heart rate measurements with invalid times being shown on Apple Watch app

ECG support is here.

All users with an Apple Watch Series 4 or newer can import ECGs and see them organized alongside existing heart rate, workouts, notes, symptoms, and other cardiovascular data.

* Updated deeplink support for invites, sharing, and challenges

New feature: Apple Watch users who subscribe to Cardiogram Premium can now view their daily metrics on their wrist! Open the Apple Watch app and swipe right to view your Resting HR, Peak HR, Low HR, steps, and Sleep stats.

Bug fix: Apple Watch complication should now always open to the heart rate chart.

If Cardiogram has helped you improve your health, please let us know by leaving a rating and review!

New feature: Share With Doctor reports now include resting heart rate trends and most common symptoms, so your doctor can get a quick overview alongside your granular heart rate data.

Plus a few small bug fixes.
